instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2877: What is 820-2877? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2877</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Keyboard/Power Button Trouble
threads.message: With the keyboard plugged in, it doesn't boot when I press the power button or short the pads. With the keyboard unplugged, I can short the pads and it works great minus the keyboard. If I short the pads and then quickly plug in the keyboard everything works great, including the keyboard. If I then click sleep at the login screen with the keyboard plugged in, it hard shuts down (hard drive does the click sound) but it does a normal sleep when it is not plugged in. If I hold down the power button at the login screen it will do a hard shutdown so it seems that the power button is indeed working (sorta).  But if I then push it to turn it back on I get nothing.  Am I right in assuming it is the keyboard itself that is bad? I got it from another store who just did a keyboard swap and are looking for a second opinion.  Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2877</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Keyboard/Power Button Trouble
threads.message: Looks like the keyboard to me. You can connect any <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard to check, the pinout on them is all the same.
